🥢Ginger Citrus Twist + Black Pepper Crusted Beef🥢 Our new flavor has just the right zesty notes to pair perfectly with @zaynab_issa’s rich, peppery dish. Try it for yourself—recipe below! 

 
INGREDIENTS
10-12 oz steak, ideally a tender cut like strip or ribeye, sliced into ⅛” thick pieces
2 tsp + ¼ cup soy sauce
1 Tbsp cornstarch, divided
Freshly ground black pepper
1 head broccoli, chopped into 2” florets + ¾” pieces of stem
3 garlic cloves, finely chopped
1” ginger, finely chopped
1 scallion, finely chopped, dark green parts reserved for garnish
¼ cup water
2 Tbsp dark brown sugar
2 tsp apple cider vinegar
1 Tbsp neutral oil
White rice, for serving
 
METHOD
Add sliced steak, 2 tsp soy sauce, 1 ½ tsp cornstarch, and lots of freshly ground black pepper to a small bowl. Toss to coat the meat. Let sit while you prep the broccoli, garlic, ginger, and scallion.
 
Whisk 1 ½ tsp cornstarch and ¼ cup water in a small bowl until cornstarch is dissolved. Add remaining ¼ cup soy sauce, brown sugar, apple cider vinegar, and more freshly ground black pepper. Whisk until combined. Set aside.
 
Heat ¼ cup water in a large skillet with a lid over medium-high until simmering. Add broccoli florets and cover. Cook, undisturbed, until broccoli is crisp-tender, bright green, and all the water has evaporated, about 2-3 minutes. Transfer to a medium bowl. Add 1 Tbsp oil to the same skillet. Distribute steak evenly in skillet and cook, undisturbed, until a crust forms on the bottom and beef is a deep golden brown, about 2 minutes. Add garlic, ginger, and scallion, and toss to fry aromatics. Add broccoli and toss to coat. Stir sauce together again to redistribute cornstarch mixture, and pour into skillet. Bring to a boil and cook, tossing constantly, until sauce has thickened and coats the beef and broccoli.
 
Serve over rice and finish with dark green parts of scallion.

Whip. Dip. Sip. Repeat. @zaynab_issa’s whipped ricotta dip with spiced honey butter balances of fruity and floral to make for a perfect pairing with our new Orange Vanilla. Check it out below. ⬇️

Ingredients
15oz tub ricotta cheese
3/4 tsp diamond crystal kosher salt, plus more 
3 Tbsp olive oil
3 Tbsp unsalted butter or more olive oil
1/2 tsp Aleppo pepper (or 1/2 tsp smoked paprika + a pinch of cayenne)
1 tsp honey
1/2 cup mixed tender herbs, such as dill, mint, and/or basil
Lemon zest and juice, for serving
Crusty baguette/crudités, for serving
Flaky sea salt, for serving

 
Method
Add ricotta and 1/2 kosher salt to the bowl of a food processor. Process on high while streaming in olive oil slowly through opening at the top of food processor until ricotta is smooth and creamy, about 2-3 minutes. Transfer to a shallow bowl and smooth out surface to level.
 
Meanwhile, heat 3 Tbsp butter or olive oil and a pinch of kosher salt to a small skillet over medium heat. Once butter has melted, add aleppo pepper flakes and stir. Cook until the fat is fragrant and has turned orange, about 30 seconds. Remove from heat and add 1 tsp honey and stir to combine.
 
Spoon honey butter over ricotta and top with herbs and lemon zest. Squeeze over lemon juice just before serving. Top with flaky sea salt.

Ingredients:
For the basil simple syrup:
5 basil leaves
1 cup sugar
1 cup water
For the mocktail:
1/2 oz. basil simple syrup
1/2 oz. fresh mango juice
A pinch of sea salt
1 can Mango Black Tea Spindrift
Instructions:
Make the basil simple syrup:
Bring water and sugar to a simmer in a saucepan.
Add basil leaves and simmer for 5 minutes.
Remove basil leaves and set saucepan aside to cool.
Add basil simple syrup, mango juice, and a pinch of sea salt to a glass and stir.
Add ice and fill remainder of glass with a Mango Black Tea Spindrift. Cheers!

Voici notre Paloma Boréal, un exquis mélange du sirop de lime de Monsieur Cocktail, du Gin Boréal sans alcool, et du pétillant de @montelliercanada au pamplemousse. 🍃🍊 Essaie ce délice rafraîchissant, tu ne seras pas déçu.e ! 🌿🌟

Ingrédients
3/4 oz (22 ml) de tequila blanco 100% agave
3/4 oz (22 ml) de gin boréal sans alcool Monsieur Cocktail
1/2 oz (15 ml) de sirop de lime Monsieur Cocktail
Une pincée de sel
3 oz (90 ml) de Montellier pétillant au pamplemousse
Tranche de pamplemousse (pour décorer)  
 Préparation
1. Dans un verre haut (highball), ajouter tous les ingrédients (sauf le Montellier) et remplir de glace.
2. Mélanger à la cuillère jusqu’à ce que vos doigts deviennent très froids.
3. Allonger de Montellier pétillant au pamplemousse.
4. Décorer d'une tranche de pamplemousse frais.
